item.description: Standard Perl module README file, explains what is required and what it does. Start here if you can't think of where else to start.

item.description: Basic introduction to RSS and the XML::RSS::Tools module.

item.description: The POD for the module as pretty HTML. This explains how to use the module, and should be enough to get you going.

item.title: Example 1
item.description: This very simple example shows how to create a basic command line tool.

item.title: Example 2
item.description: This more complex example is designed to show a normal command line or CGI application.

item.title: Example 3
item.description: Another simple example shows how to create a basic command line tool.

item.title: Example 4
item.description: A more complex example, we turn off RSS normalisation, and use a single XSLT stylesheet to deal with all possible RSS feeds.

item.title: Example 5
item.description: This example is a complete RSS client application. It has been designed to run as a CGI or Apache::Registry application, generating neat "portlet" style HTML pages from RSS feeds. It includes local file cacheing and is fully functional and complete.
